title: Biden signs sanctions bills targeting Russian oil and trade with Russia and Belarus
description: President Joe Biden on Friday signed two bills levying further sanctions on Russia and Belarus, the White House announced.

title: Will Smith banned from attending Oscars for 10 years
description: Will Smith will not be allowed to attend the Academy Awards for the next ten years, as a result of his slapping comedian Chris Rock on-stage during this year's Oscar ceremony, The Academy of Motion Pictures Arts & Sciences announced in a statement obtained by CNN.

title: 'A total lack of discipline': Clarissa Ward visits abandoned Russian foxholes
description: CNN's Clarissa Ward reports from Chernihiv, Ukraine after Russian forces left the city decimated.

title: Brazil's Amazon rainforest has already reached a new deforestation record this year
description: The portion of Amazon rainforest impacted by deforestation in the first three months of 2022 was the highest ever recorded, according to a new report by Brazil's National Institute for Space Research (INPE).

title: 'Dumped by email,' says cyclist's mother as British Cycling bans transgender riders from competition
description: British Cycling has suspended its transgender and non-binary participation policy after the sport's world governing body banned a trans rider from competing in a women's event in the UK earlier this month.

title: Taylor Swift's childhood home hits the market for $1M
description: The superstar's childhood home in Pennsylvania is for sale for nearly $1 million, where she started to learn music and lived until 14.

title: Only one Republican senator stayed to applaud after Jackson was confirmed
description: CNN's Manu Raju and Gloria Borger discuss how Senator Mitt Romney (R-UT) was the only Republican to stand to applaud after Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson's confirmation vote.

title: Europe turns its back on Russian coal. Is oil next?
description: European leaders have agreed to phase out Russian coal imports as part of a new package of sanctions triggered by evidence of atrocities in Bucha, Ukraine. An oil embargo could be next.

title: Putin exposed the limits of Macron's influence
description: On February 20, Emmanuel Macron held a phone call with Vladimir Putin. Shortly after it ended, the French President announced he would broker a summit between his Russian counterpart and US President Joe Biden, on the condition that Russia did not invade its neighbor.

title: Russia or die: After weeks under Putin's bombs, these Ukrainians were given only one way out
Picasso portrait of his young mistress to go on sale for first time
description: Pablo Picasso's "Femme nue couchée" ("Naked woman reclining"), a portrait of his lover and muse Marie-Thérèse Walter, could sell for more than $60 million when it makes its auction debut next month.

title: NASA to begin third attempt at crucial moon mission test on Saturday
description: A third attempt at a crucial prelaunch test for NASA's Artemis I mission to the moon will begin on Saturday, after the two previous tries were called off, the agency said in a news release.

title: French Muslims concerned at rhetoric in presidential election
description: CNN's Nada Bashir speaks to French Muslims and their concerns with the upcoming presidential campaign, which features a number candidates with Islamophobic messaging.

title: Should you get your fourth booster shot now?
description: More people can now get second Covid-19 booster shots after federal health officials announced they are allowing a broader group to get fourth doses of the two messenger RNA Covid-19 vaccines made by Pfizer/BioNTech and Moderna.

title: SpaceX just launched paying customers to the ISS. Here's everything you need to know
description: A SpaceX rocket carrying three paying customers and a former NASA astronaut is slated to take off from Kennedy Space Center in Florida on Friday morning, kicking off a first-of-its-kind mission that will take the group on a 10-day mission to the International Space Station.

title: Man jailed for London murder of 28-year-old teacher Sabina Nessa
description: A man has been jailed for life after pleading guilty to the murder of 28-year-old teacher Sabina Nessa in a killing that sparked renewed outcry about the UK's epidemic of violence against women and girls.

title: 'We will be destitute': Middle class hit with rising medical costs
description: CNN's Vanessa Yurkevich reports on middle class Americans struggling to pay for rising medical costs caused by record-high inflation.

title: See how small town fought off group of Russian tanks
description: CNN senior national correspondent Ed Lavandera visits Voznesensk, Ukraine, and speaks to residents that successfully fought back Russian forces.

title: Opinion: Obama's blind spot on Russia
description: "The 1980s are now calling to ask for their foreign policy back."

title: How Bourdain's favorite songs, movies and books inspired a film about his life
description: His mission was a complicated one: Tell the complex story of the late Anthony Bourdain, a man he had never met.

title: Bucha killings: Russian metal company calls for an investigation
description: Russian metals company Rusal has called for an investigation into the killing of civilians in Bucha, a suburb of the Ukrainian capital Kiev.

title: Recession-proof stocks are having a moment
description: Investors are worried that the risks of a recession are rising in the United States. In Europe, they fear economies could also stall while inflation soars, delivering the toxic combination known as "stagflation."

title: The man who bought a cruise ship on Craigslist
description: It's not every day that you spot a cruise ship for sale on Craigslist. So Chris Willson was immediately intrigued when he stumbled across a 293-foot vessel listed on the classified advertisements website back in 2008.

title: 40 companies suspend operations amid Shanghai lockdown
description: China's unwavering commitment to stamping out Covid by locking down big cities such as Shanghai threatens to deal a hefty shock to its vast economy, place more strain on global supply chains and further fuel inflation.

title: Why Xi can't quit zero-Covid
Why Xi can't quit zero-Covid
description: Those hoping China relaxes its zero-Covid policy would have been deeply disappointed with Vice Premier Sun Chunlan's  loud and clear signal that an end was nowhere near in sight, during a visit to virus hotspot Shanghai last week.

title: Dmitry Muratov, Russian Nobel Peace Prize winner, says he was attacked with red paint
description: A Nobel Peace Prize-winning newspaper editor says he was attacked with red paint while traveling on a train in Russia.

title: Video shows Covid worker beat dog after its owner tested positive
description: A pet dog was beaten to death by a health worker in Shanghai in an incident that sparked fury online, offering a glimpse into the growing frustrations of locked-down residents in China's Covid-19 hotspot. CNN's Kristie Lu Stout reports on this and other videos showing the effects of China's strict lockdown.

title: Blood on the stairwell: Inside the brutal occupation of Bucha
description: Yana Rudenko lived in a basement for 14 days during the Russian occupation of Bucha, Ukraine.  She describes her distressing story, including some very traumatic scenes.

title: Breathtaking prints by National Geographic photographers on sale in aid of Ukraine
description: Emperor penguins releasing millions of micro-bubbles from their feathers, children's dresses hanging on a laundry line on a porch in Puerto Rico, and students standing among fountains in Kyiv are all works by National Geographic photographers that are on sale to support Ukraine.

title: Tencent shuts down its rival to Amazon's Twitch as China's crackdown on tech continues
description: Tencent is shutting down its game streaming service, in another sign that China's sweeping campaign on Big Tech and a crackdown on the live streaming industry has sharply slowed growth at some of the country's most powerful internet companies.

title: Meta removes Facebook accounts to tackle misinformation ahead of Philippine election
description: Meta Platforms Inc on Wednesday suspended a network of over 400 accounts, pages and groups ahead of general elections in the Philippines as the Facebook parent moves to crack down on hate speech and misinformation.

title: Costa Rica airport reopens after plane skids off runway, splits in two
description: Costa Rica's Juan Santamaria International Airport reopened on Thursday hours after a Boeing 757-200 cargo aircraft operated by DHL made an emergency landing and skidded off the runway, separating its tail, aviation authorities said.

title: 'More beautiful than Europe': Indians flock to Kashmir's lakes, boats
description: Indian-administered Kashmir is attracting record tourists after the easing of pandemic restrictions and some improvement in the security situation, bolstering local businesses.

title: Two killed, many injured in Tel Aviv shooting
description: A shooting in Tel Aviv killed two people and wounded many others late Thursday, Israeli officials said.

title: This drone is so effective, Ukrainian troops are singing about it
description: Drones are playing a key role in Ukraine's counter offensives against Russia's invasion. One is proving so effective that Ukrainian forces are singing its praises, literally. CNN's Jomana Karadsheh has the exclusive report.

title: Pink Floyd to release first new music in 28 years in support of Ukraine
description: Legendary rock band Pink Floyd is releasing a new single "Hey Hey Rise Up" on Friday in support of the people of Ukraine, the band said in a statement on Thursday.

title: Why sanctions won't deter Putin
description: The Biden administration Wednesday slapped sanctions on Russian President Vladimir Putin's daughters, as well as imposing sanctions on two of Russia's biggest banks.

title: Why Russia might struggle to maintain its digital iron curtain
description: On March 14, the same day Russia banned Instagram, Russian tech entrepreneur Alexander Zobov announced he would soon launch a local version of the popular photo and video sharing app called Rossgram.

title: A week of history and rabid partisanship encapsulates an extreme Washington age
description: Ketanji Brown Jackson's shattering of a racial glass ceiling, in a week also marked by the naked ambition of the Republicans who smeared her, the delusional demagoguery of an ex-President and a touch of the bizarre, reflected an historic and extreme Washington age.

title: Anita Hill calls Ketanji Brown Jackson confirmation an 'important cultural moment'
description: Brandeis University professor Anita Hill said Thursday that Ketanji Brown Jackson's confirmation to the US Supreme Court marked an "important cultural moment" for the court and the country.

title: Radio intercepts: Russian troops 'discussed killing civilians'
description: Germany's foreign intelligence service told a parliamentary committee Wednesday that it has intercepted radio communications where Russian soldiers talked about shooting soldiers and civilians in Ukraine, a source with knowledge of the meeting said.

title: How lab-grown sushi could help tackle overfishing
description: Smoked, poached, grilled, pan-seared, and even raw: salmon is as versatile as it is popular -- and has become the world's largest single fish commodity by value.

title: 'Huge tragedy': Kremlin admits 'significant' losses of troops
The UN is flawed, and Russia's war on Ukraine is exposing all of its imperfections
description: With every image of a murdered civilian lying on the sidewalk in a Ukrainian town devastated by occupying Russian forces, with every interview of a tearful woman mourning dead relatives by the side of a grave, the level of frustration rises around the world.

title: 'Bye bye': Model among Russian influencers destroying their luxury handbags
description: Russian women use scissors to cut up their $7,000 Chanel bags. CNN's Jeanne Moos explains the carnage on these pricey purses.

title: Senate confirms Ketanji Brown Jackson to be first Black woman to sit on Supreme Court
description: The Senate confirmed President Joe Biden's Supreme Court nominee Ketanji Brown Jackson on Thursday in a historic vote that paves the way for her to become the first Black woman to serve on the highest court in the nation.
